--- title: "R'tichoke: A Repository of R Content" ---

R'tichoke

Peeling back the layers of R programming, one article at a time

## Welcome to R'tichoke R'tichoke is a comprehensive repository of R programming content, tutorials, and resources. Whether you're just starting your journey with R or you're an experienced data scientist looking to expand your toolkit, you'll find valuable content here to help you grow your skills. ## What You'll Find Here - **Data Visualization**: Techniques for creating compelling visualizations with ggplot2 and other packages - **Data Wrangling**: Methods for efficient data manipulation using the tidyverse - **Statistical Analysis**: Applied statistics using R's powerful analytical capabilities - **Machine Learning**: Practical implementations of ML algorithms in R - **Reproducible Research**: Best practices for creating reproducible analyses with R Markdown and Quarto ## Latest Articles Check out our [blog](/posts.qmd) for the latest tutorials, case studies, and tips on R programming. ## Getting Started New to R? Start here: 1. [Installing R and RStudio](/installation.qmd) - Set up your development environment 2. [Introduction to Analytics with R](/posts/intro-to-r-analytics.qmd) - Learn the basics 3. [Data Wrangling with dplyr](/posts/data-wrangling-with-dplyr.qmd) - Level up your data manipulation skills ## About R'tichoke R'tichoke was created to serve as a centralized repository of high-quality R content. All articles are written in R Markdown (`.qmd` files) with executable code examples, making it easy to follow along and learn by doing. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. â„¹ Please use `linewidth` instead. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![R's popularity continues to grow in data science](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
